head.supplied: 5/10/86 ¶ ¶ Let me thank you, dear Mr Shillinglaw, for your circumspect kindness in sending me the copy of Capt. Musgrave's diary. ¶ I read it at the time in a periodical, but never had a book-copy ...

div.p: Box 251/3, Shillinglaw papers, La Trobe Australian manuscripts collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.
MS annotations by Shillinglaw: 'Rec 5.X.86' and 'Answed 7.X.86'. Letter not found. 5/10/86

Let me thank you, dear Mr Shillinglaw, for your circumspect kindness in sending me the copy of Capt. Musgrave's diary.
See J. Shillinglaw to M, 1 October 1886. I read it at the time in a periodical, but never had a book-copy myself; now that the antarctic interests commence to be revived, I will read this book, so thoughtfully edited by you, with care, before I send it off to Capt Armstrong. Are copies anywhere purchasable?
Musgrave (1865). A copy of this work is in the library at MEL. I should like very much to have a short conversation with you, prior to your final R. Comm. Report
The first progress report of the Royal Commission on Vegetable Products, 1885-94, was published in 1886. It included evidence and documents from M: B86.08.06, B86.08.07, B86.08.08. Shillinglaw was secretary to the Royal Commission. is printed.
